website_summaries.verdict: Packed with a trio of bayou-based meat sources, these chunky baked treats are easy to digest and are a healthy snack for your dog.
pros: Made with real catfish and shrimp
No corn, wheat, gluten, or soy
cons: Very difficult to break into smaller pieces by hand

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these treats and since my one dog is allergic to so much these are in his perimeter but they come totally broken up ! There needs to be better way to package these products so they are not bags of crumbled mess .
customer_reviews.author: Toni Padilla

customer_reviews.title: It's a great brand and I appreciate the great ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my dog wont eat these. It's a great brand and I appreciate the great ingredients. But the biscuits are much too large. I had to break them up to offer to her, but by then she had lost interest. And a day later, she still wont try the crumbles. And my dog loves fish, so I'm surprised she wouldn't even try them. Then, my hands smelled like fish after having to break them apart. Too much hassle and mess.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiChick

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat the price. Although my boy doesn't really care for the taste, it seems to be helping with his allergies. He is a junk food junkie..came packaged good and on time delivery
customer_reviews.author: CRich808

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: Oh man, the dogs love this stuff. It contains good ingredients and I feel good about using this as a treat. I also feel that I am helping in my own small way to help control that dangerous population of alligators in Florida. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Born on a Monday

customer_reviews.title: Okay Treat
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy the Salmon flavor but was curious to just see how the dogs liked this new one. They honestly don't like it as well and the treats actually smell pretty fishy! It's kind of high in salt as well on the ingredients. Not really worth paying the extra money for this flavor in particular.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Smelly but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Dog ripped in to them he was so excited! They are some smelly treats, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Sandlin

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves them
customer_reviews.text: While I can’t vouch for the flavor, my puppy does
customer_reviews.author: David Leikin

customer_reviews.title: Pit approved
customer_reviews.text: My Pit loves these Bayou biscuitd and they are hard to come by. The Omegas in this biscuit are great for his skin, especially since he has skin allergens. I give him options and he always paws for the Bayou. Only downfall for us is the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Webster

customer_reviews.title: He really perks up when I mention his "biscuits"!
customer_reviews.text: My standard poodle has a tender tummy and is limited in the kind of treats he can have. He picked these out at the store rather than his regular poultry version, and is excited to have them. Good value here.
customer_reviews.author: Surfwalkerhhi

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves these
customer_reviews.text: My pup loved these. A monthly staple in my household
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. My dogs usually don't get excited about biscuits, but they do seem to enjoy these more than any other biscuits. It could be the unique flavor of alligator and catfish.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: My dogs absolutely love the BB Duck treats
customer_reviews.text: My dogs absolutely love the BB Duck treats. Thought I'd give these a try. Not nearly as good. They are harder and the dogs don't like them as well, although they did eat them. They're OK, but I won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Very healthy and my Lab loves them
customer_reviews.text: My only suggestion would be to make the biscuits about 1/4 the size that they are.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie McNair

customer_reviews.title: I got these for my sister to give as treats ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my sister to give as treats to her dog, and he really enjoys them. We wanted something that was grain free because of his allergies, and he has suffered no ill effects.
customer_reviews.author: L. Knudson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes crazy for these and she’s pretty picky. Love the natural ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: JOliva

customer_reviews.title: Not for picky dogs
customer_reviews.text: My big dog liked these ok but he has other favorites.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ketner

customer_reviews.title: Aiko isn't slithering...  Not yet anyway...  LOL
customer_reviews.text: My husband was stunned to learn the Bayou Blend treats are made with alligator meat. He suugested "Aiko may begin slithering around, hissing and baring his teeth then we'd know the treats are having an impact!" Aiko absolutely loves these shrimp scented square biscuits gobbling them up rapidly. I use them as "scooby snacks" for doing his business outside.
customer_reviews.author: JeriOwl

customer_reviews.title: he'd probably love anything as long as it's edible
customer_reviews.text: The pupper loves this flavor (although, he'd probably love anything as long as it's edible...).
customer_reviews.author: Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Great, healthy dog treat!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these biscuits! I always strive to feed my dogs healthy products. I show and breed them so their health is very important. Even my finicky eaters love these.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: did a taste test
customer_reviews.text: finally got a chance to taste-test the "real" jerky using 6 diff brands, all chicken, all very similar. lined them up on ppr towel with each brand penciled above. the blue wilderness chicken jerky was the 1st choice, didnt take him long to decide. some were much more expensive, but now I know. have always wanted to line up treats and do a taste test without getting mixed up. next will be soft treats and soft sticks.
customer_reviews.author: bonanaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Consuming Alligator?
customer_reviews.text: These are new for our dogs. We got the Alligator and Catfish Bayou Biscuits. The number one ingredient is Alligator then Shrimp Meal, real bayou food. Anyway, the ingredients are top notch all the way, no grain fillers, artificial preservatives , color or flavors. Personally I think they have a tad of a nasty smell, but I'm not the one eating them! Our two Miniature-Schnauzers will go through their list of tricks to get one, they scarf these things down like candy. We do break them in half as they are a very generous portion......the bag lasts longer too. I can safely say that we are all quite satisfied with this product, the ingredients as well as the price.
customer_reviews.author: EdE

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Alligator Biscuits
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs think theseare great! They are pretty big biscuits although my large dog can eat it in seconds my small dog breaks it up into four smaller pieces and then chews each piece and then cleans the crumbs up off the floor. I really like that these have alligator. I want to try alligator myself! Maybe I'll try a. I like that these are in a stay fresh zipper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Darlaina Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Great nutritous snack for the dog in your life!
customer_reviews.text: I love Blue Buffalo products for my Roxie. Not only are they a quality product (made of all natural ingredients), but they are good for her and she loves them. These Bayou biscuits are one of her favorites. Perfect size for a mid-size dog (she is a 38 lb Aussie Shepherd mix), she gobbles these up as a reward every time I offer them to her. I depend on Blue Buffalo to give her nutritious treats and the Bayou Blend biscuits are no exception. Kudos to Wilderness Blue Buffalo for another product both I and my dog love!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: My dog really likes these treats, which is not surprising since he (and I) like pretty much everything Blue Buffalo makes. The treats are kind of large for a small dog, but my Newfoundland scarfs them down. I have been putting them in a treat dispenser and making him work to get them out. My only complaint is that the first ingredient is alligator. We spend the winters in Florida and he likes the taste of these so much I am a little afraid he will smell a real alligator and try to go after it. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Here is my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them but they are crumbly and smelly
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves these treats, but I am a bit divided on them. I have given her the Bayou blend puppy food and that was fine, but these Bayou Biscuits smell awful! They smell like a fish store, and not in a good way. But she loves them and enjoys them as treats. That being said, since they are grain-free they tend to be crumbly as well. So my dog happily crunches on biscuits while the floor gets covered in crumbly, smelly bits. So 5 stars for her, 3 stars for me - averages to 4. Loved by dogs but not by me!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Avrunin

customer_reviews.title: Not digestion-friendly for the Resident Hound.
customer_reviews.text: Both the dog and the humans here are, generally, fans of Blue Buffalo kibble and treats. But not this variety. This particular variety gave the dog a VERY upset stomach, and--I'm surmising--gut pain as well. Bad batch or bad ingredients? I dunno. Alligators aren't native to SoCal, and obviously aren't familiar dining fare. Going forward, leaving alligator-meat products off the dog's menu seems like a Good Idea.
customer_reviews.author: Worddancer Redux

customer_reviews.title: Alligator biscuits made in the USA -- maybe too large for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoys these treats but doesn't go crazy over them like say a piece of apple. I can't speak to their flavor, but they certainly smell alligatory :-) It is certainly a nice change from your typical dog treat. My only problem with the biscuits is their size: my dog is only 7 lbs and the biscuits were a bit too large for him. Usually this is not a big deal because I can break them, but these are kind of crumbly.
customer_reviews.author: David Koski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a larger dog
customer_reviews.text: These are a good size treat...perfect for a larger dog. Very crunchy and fresh. They come in a re-sealable package to help keep them as tasty as they are after first being opened. This company is well known for their high quality pet food and treats. I think they have lived up to their reputation. My dog loved these treats.
customer_reviews.author: MommaMia

customer_reviews.title: My dog isn't normally a fan of biscuits, but ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog isn't normally a fan of biscuits, but she sure made an exception for Wilderness Bayou Biscuits. Must be the alligator and catfish. These are not swallow-size biscuits, not for cocker spaniels, anyway. She has to break it into pieces, but she has no problem doing that. Yum! Probably the first biscuits she's ever gotten excited over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Healthy treats that dogs love...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs all love these treats. They gobble them up and beg for more. And it's no surprise, because they're made with all healthy ingredients like alligator, shrimp, potatoes and catfish. Made in the USA, grain-free and with no artificial ingredients, these are treats that you can feel good about feeding to your beloved dogs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Worth

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love these biscuits
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these biscuits! I was a little skeptical about the alligator ingredient, but they seem to like it quite well! These have a lighter texture than most dog biscuits, and they are quite easy to break in half if you need to. I love that they are grain free.
customer_reviews.author: Wynne R. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Grain free, dog approves of taste
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves these dog biscuits. They're pretty large and evidently exceptionally appealing to my golden retriever. I really like that the treats are grain free and contain lots of protein, so I feel that my pup is getting some high quality treats and not just filler.
customer_reviews.author: MElise

customer_reviews.title: Dogs gobble them up
customer_reviews.text: From big dogs to little dogs, they all liked this bayou blend. Was it the hint of gator meat in it that they seemed to love so much? Way too crunchy and hard to try myself. So whatever it is, my taste tester dogs loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Beggerow

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with allergies.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has all kinds of allergies, wheat and chicken are his big ones, we don't often buy him cookies for that reason. I decided to try these as the ingredient list was interesting, and nothing jumped out at me as a known allergy. Well he's been enjoying these cookies for the last few days, with no sign of an allergic reaction. So we have a happy dog and owners!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Blue Buffalo Wilderness Bayou Biscuits High Protein Grain Free Crunchy Dog Treats Biscuits, Alligator & Catfish 8-oz bag
product_meta.description: Your dog will love getting his paws on Blue wilderness Bayou Biscuits, tasty, meat-rich snacks inspired by the unique flavors of the Southern Bayou with real alligator and catfish. Made with the finest natural ingredients, These nutritious baked Biscuits will more than satisfy your dog’s love of meat and his primal Instinct to crunch something tasty.
feature_bullets: High-Quality Alligator, Catfish And Shrimp Meal Supply The Protein Your Dog Needs

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
